title: Castle Naze Walking Route

images.title: Dave Dunford / Castle Naze
images.caption: Castle Naze. Part of the earthworks of Castle Naze promontory fort (from the eastern corner looking west).

images.title: Dave Dunford / Castle Naze
images.caption: The defensive attributes of this Iron Age promontory fort are obvious from this angle (viewed from Cowlow Lane).

images.title: Dave.Dunford, CC BY-SA 4.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/4.0>, via Wikimedia Commons

images.title: Combs Edge by Peter Barr, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Combs Edge

description: This walk visits an elevated fort near Chapel en le Frith in the White Peak area of the Peak District. You can start the walk from the parking area on Cowlow Lane. From here you can pick up footpaths heading south to the Promontory fort on Combs Edge. There's great views here down to Combs Reservoir and across to the Peak District Fells. There's also some wonderful rock formations and steep cliffs which are popular with rock climbers. The walk could also be started from Chapel en le Frith rail station which lies just to the north of the parking area. Footpaths can be followed south from here to the site.

details.subtitle: Further Information and Other Local Ideas
details.content: Just to the south west there's some nice trails around Lamaload Reservoir, Errwood Reservoir and Fernilee Reservoir. Near here there's also the climb to Shining Tor and Cats Tor where there are more fantastic views to enjoy. For more walking ideas in the area see the White Peak Walks and Peak District Walks page.
